alternative_parents.description: Ketones have the generic structure RC(=O)R', where R = aryl group and R'=alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl alkyl ketones

alternative_parents.description: Alkylamines in which the alkyl group is substituted at one carbon atom by an aromatic hydrocarbyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aralkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Heterocyclic compounds containing a pyrrole ring substituted at one or more positions.
alternative_parents.name: Substituted pyrroles

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a morpholine moiety, which consists of a six-member aliphatic saturated ring with the formula C4H9NO, where the oxygen and nitrogen atoms lie at positions 1 and 4, respectively.
alternative_parents.name: Morpholines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an amine group, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a trialkylamine group, characterized by exactly three alkyl groups bonded to the amino nitrogen.
alternative_parents.name: Trialkylamines

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the dialkyl ether functional group, with the formula ROR', where R and R' are alkyl groups.
alternative_parents.name: Dialkyl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

class.description: Organic compounds containing an indole, which is a bicyclic ring system made up of a six-membered benzene ring fused to a five-membered nitrogen-containing pyrrole ring.
class.name: Indoles and derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as indoles and derivatives. These are organic compounds containing an indole, which is a bicyclic ring system made up of a six-membered benzene ring fused to a five-membered nitrogen-containing pyrrole ring.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds containing an indole, which is a bicyclic ring system made up of a six-membered benzene ring fused to a five-membered nitrogen-containing pyrrole ring.
direct_parent.name: Indoles and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

superclass.description: Compounds containing a ring with least one carbon atom and one non-carbon atom.
superclass.name: Organoheterocyclic compounds
